org.colomoto.mddlib.internal

Class MDDManagerProxy

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.colomoto.mddlib.internal.MDDManagerProxy
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    MDDManager

    public class MDDManagerProxy
extends Object
implements MDDManager
    MDDManager adding a custom order on top of an existing MDDStore. It acts mostly as proxy to the actual store but provides a uniform API. It should be created through the getProxy method. For convenience, MDDManager offers a wrapper method: getManager().
    Author:
    Aurelien Naldi

      • getManager

        public MDDManager getManager(List<?> order)
        Description copied from interface: MDDManager
        Get a new manager for this MDD Store, using a custom variable order. The new manager will use the same MDDStore as backend: it is just a different view of the same MDD dataset.
        Specified by:
        getManager in interface MDDManager
        Parameters:
        order - requested variable order.
        Returns:
        a new manager (this if the order is the same)

        Parameters:

        Returns:

      • free

        public void free(int pos)
        Description copied from interface: MDDManager
        Free a node. If it is not used at all anymore, it will be removed from the data structure.

        This should be used for each node id that was obtained through one of the get_?node() method, or for the one explicitly marked as used.

        Note that the space will be made available for new nodes, but it will NOT be returned to the garbage collector.

        Specified by:
        free in interface MDDManager
        See Also:
        use(int), get_bnode(int, int, int), get_mnode(int, int[])

      • use

        public int use(int node)
        Description copied from interface: MDDManager
        Mark a node as used. This is done automatically when creating or reusing a node. In most cases, manually calling this should not be necessary. If you do call it, remember to call free(int) when you release it.
        Specified by:
        use in interface MDDManager
        Returns:
        the ID of the node (yes, the same as the parameter, just as convenience)

      • isleaf

        public boolean isleaf(int node)
        Specified by:
        isleaf in interface MDDManager
        Parameters:
        node - the ID of the tested node.
        Returns:
        true if id denotes a leaf in this manager

      • getChild

        public int getChild(int node,
           int value)
        Description copied from interface: MDDManager
        Get a specific child for a node. Note: the child is not counted as used, do not free it (or call manager.use() before)
        Specified by:
        getChild in interface MDDManager
        Parameters:
        node - id of a node
        value - assignment value
        Returns:
        the id of the child node reached when assigning this value to the variable of the provided node.

      • getChildren

        public int[] getChildren(int node)
        Description copied from interface: MDDManager
        Get all the children of a given node. Node: this will create a new array to hold the children. Children are not counted as used, do not free them (or call manager.use() before)
        Specified by:
        getChildren in interface MDDManager
        Returns:
        an array holding all the children, or null if it is a leaf.

      • not

        public int not(int node)
        Description copied from interface: MDDManager
        Logical not, performed by flipping leaves 0 and 1.
        Specified by:
        not in interface MDDManager
        Returns:
        the ID of the flipped MDD root

                       int other)
        Description copied from interface: MDDManager
        Determine the relation between two nodes. Mainly used by operators to select the appropriate code path.
        Specified by:
        getRelation in interface MDDManager
        Returns:
        an NodeRelation value denoting which node is a leaf or has the highest ranked variable

      • getSign

          MDDVariable pivot)
        Description copied from interface: MDDManager
        Infer the effect of a variable in a given MDD.
        Specified by:
        getSign in interface MDDManager
        Parameters:
        node - the MDD
        pivot - the variable of interest
        Returns:
        0 for no effect, 1 for positive effect, -1 for negative effect or 2 for dual effect
